page.title: 07FARMING
page.content: About 2 miles from Chester-le-St. is a large Victorian farmstead with a cottage for the farm workers plus a few small storage buildings. This farmstead is now used for{beef cattle and{poultry.}When first built the farm had stables and byres. The loft was used for hay. This farm is now rented from a large property owner and 2 acres is ploughed so there is no need for machinery. Most of the farming is devoted to{poultry}which provides casual employment before Christmas when the{poultry}is plucked. There is a large local population so there is a great demand for Christmas Turkeys and Chickens. There are many farms in this area and the large{dairy}farm is 160 years old. The modern{dairy}is only 10 yrs. old and an extension was built 3 yrs. ago.
